{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Apgar score is a measure of the newborn's condition immediately after birth, based on five physiological parameters. The score ranges from 0 to 10, with higher scores indicating better condition. In this case, most of the readings are found to be 7 or above. This suggests that the majority of the children in the hospital have good Apgar scores, indicating a healthy condition. Since the data is concentrated towards the higher end of the scale, it is likely that the data distribution is negatively skewed.", "answer_choice": "B. Negatively skewed data"}
